text: - Hello, and welcome to "Community Chats."

I'm Aley Hammer, and today,
we're interviewing John Loke,
the CTO at Kacific.
John, welcome to the show.
Can you start by telling our audience
a little bit about Kacific and how the AWS
leadership principle Customer Obsession
translates into Kacific's mission?

- Kacific is a next-generation
broadband satellite operator.

In 2019, we launched our
geostationary Ka-band satellite,
Kacific 1, into space.

Today, we are committed to
providing universal fast
and high-quality broadband to 25 countries
in the Asia Pacific.

Kacific uses proven space
technologies to solve
the lack of affordable broadband internet

in rural and underserved
regions in the Asian Pacific

by making internet
affordable and accessible.

Wedding our customer needs
for affordable broadband

and our continuous drive
to improve service quality
and reliability for our customer,

Kacific aligns nicely with
AWS Customer Obsession

leadership principle, as
we strongly believe too
in being customer-first.

- And John, Kacific
recently won multiple awards

at the Pacific Telecommunications
Council in January.

So can you tell us a
little bit more about your
outstanding achievements there?

- We are very honored
to have been recognized

and awarded two awards at
PDC 2022 earlier in January.

We were recognized as the
Outstanding Satellite Company
of the Year with our innovative retail
franchise model, GigStarter.
GigStarter was created during COVID-19

to address the shift in
needs for free managed
and prepackaged plans that can be sold
month by month, plan by plan.

With our innovative technology
and Agile business model,

we have managed to reduce
the price for a gigabit
by nearly 50% in our market.

The other award that we
are very honored to receive

was Outstanding Support
for PTC Vision and Mission.
When the COVID-19 hit, medical care

and realtime communication
became more crucial
than ever for many remote communities.

This was when Kacific
stepped in to bridge this gap

with GuarantCo, where we
provided free installation

of our visa terminals
and a free 30 gigabyte
to 1,000 rural medical facilities.

Medical professionals are
now able to coordinate
with COVID-19 health response and arrange

emergency evacuation
efficiently, saving more lives.

- These are amazing
awards, and you should be

so proud of everything
Kacific has achieved.
So John, why did Kacific actually decide
to move all in on AWS?

- Our focus has always
been to work with leading

international partners to
complement our satellite assets

and advance the global
broadband infrastructure.
Kacific is seeking a cloud-first approach

to provide accessible high-quality
cost-effective broadband

internet connectivity,
and this is best achieved

with scalability, agility,
and AI readiness of AWS.
- Thank you for sharing, and how does AWS

actually help Kacific
on a day-to-day basis?
- AWS now holds our IT infrastructure
and critical business application.
This reduces our time to market

and enhances our network
management, helping us respond
more rapidly to customer requests.

Kacific can now deliver
more detailed levels

of monitoring and reporting,
providing our customer

with key network information
at more granular levels
and ultimately improving their experience.
AWS suite of cloud services gives Kacific

the agility to scale its
operation support system
and business support system.
Market entry is easier, as adding capacity

and storage is managed
with a simple request

without the need to
contract house or set up

a physical server, which can
be a long and tedious process.

- How amazing that you've
been able to respond

more quickly to customer
requests and achieve

that deeper level of
reporting and monitoring
as well as scalability, and John,

to round up this
interview, how does Kacific

embrace the AWS leadership
principle Think Big,

and how does this translate
into the next steps
for your company?

- Since Kacific launched
its Kacific 1 satellite
in December 2019, the company's operation

has scaled rapidly
across the Asia Pacific.
Kacific currently operates in 25 countries
around Pacific and Southeast Asia,

has connected more than one
million people in the region,

becoming the largest
Ka-band satellite operator.
Kacific now is working towards launching

a second satellite,
Kacific 2, which we'll see
enter new and larger markets.
Our total addressable market will grow
by at least a factor of five, a level
of growth that's best achieved
with the scalability, agility,
and AI readiness for partner like AWS.

- John, thank you so much
for coming on the show today.
It's been a pleasure speaking to you.

It's such an interesting space,
this whole satellite space,

so thank you so much, and
if anyone has any questions,

please pop them in the
comment section below,
and we'll get back to you.
Thank you so much.
